column2: CLIFFKU4GW, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on a 25 mg dose of this drug for 21 days per month for 6 months now and it has effectively dropped my m-spike protein level from 1.1 to 0.10 during this time period with little noticeable side effects. The only prevalent side effect I have experienced after 6 months use is a general feeling of being drained (very low energy levels).

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: it seems to ease my legs pain,but it dose not.please tell me,what can I do?

column1: Treatment to Prevent Recurrent Aphthous Stomatitis
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: 30+ years of non-stop canker sores outbreaks in clusters. Sores break out on roof, base, and side of tongue in clusters. After being on it for 6 months, it is finally under control. It is an effective but expansive drug. However, it does help to control pain & re-occurance  of the outbreaks. End of my mysery! Finally I have a life to speak, eat, and drink water!
Behcet's arms hands and fingertips  same for legs feet and very tips

column2: willys, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: my father age 75 at the time had a bad reaction, congestive heart failure,stomach cramps, vomiting. he was in the hospital for 3 days. will never use this drug again.

column2: marie, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had few side effects. My energy level has improved since started this drug.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Kept my Multiple Myeloma under control for almost 5 years.  No side effects.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
cherrie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was in remission after 4 months of Thalomid - am still in remission 5 years later - did develop DVT & PE with greenfield filter placement; now use aspirin regularly - had stem cell transplant 3 yrs ago & doing great - protein level is very good per oncologist - do have peripheral neuropathy in feet & hands for which I take gabopentin - I am feeling fine & expect to live a long time yet - am on maintenance dose of 25 mg every  Monday, Wednesday & Friday with 325 mg aspirin daily

column2: tsassymom2@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: have sister-in-law that has multiple myeloma for 3 years and is now on this drug and it seems to be helping to keep the protein level down

column2: Captain Bob, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: After 7 months of use (increasing the dosage on a weekly basis from 25 mg to 100 mg), and also with the help of steroids,  my M protein levels were reduced to the point where I could have my stem cell procedure.  Through my own fault, I acquired neuropathy in both feet which might or might not be permanent.  I failed to tell my doctor of tingling sensations I had in my feet while increasing the dosages. Also, a blood clot formed in my right calf.  I was taken off coumidin and put on Lovenox (a self-administered shot twice a day, but with no side affects),  I preferred the Lovenox over the coumidin.
